description: Famous as the stars of the movie 'The Wild Parrots of Telegraph Hill,' this conure is bright green with a full head and face of brilliant red.
temperament: Intelligent, bold, and energetic. They are very social and can be affectionate, but they require good socialization to curb a tendency to be nippy.
loudness: Very Loud. They have a loud, sharp call and are known to be quite vocal, especially in groups.
vocalization: Fair to good talkers. They can learn a number of words and phrases and are good at mimicking sounds.
dietaryNeeds: A varied diet is important. A base of pellets, supplemented with a wide range of fresh vegetables and fruits.
healthPointers: Hardy birds with a lifespan of 25-30 years. They are known to form feral flocks in several US cities. Can be prone to PBFD.
housing: Not recommended for apartments due to their high noise level. They need a spacious cage, at least 24"W x 24"D x 36"H.
